abstract.text: Draws a control on an image. This is the main method the host application calls to draw a plug-in parameter control.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Width of the current image where the control will be drawn.
Height of the current image where the control will be drawn.
The active part of the control to draw.
into which you should draw your OSCs.
The time at which to draw the control.
This method is called when the host application wants you to draw your onscreen controls. You should draw them into the destination image. The
parameter tells which part of the control is currently selected so you can draw that control with proper highlighting.

abstract.text: Exchange data with Final Cut Pro, and create effects plug-ins for Final Cut Pro and Motion.
An image tile object that is passed between an out-of-process FxPlug plug-in and a host application.
The surface object to cast as a surface reference.
Defines the methods a plug-in must implement to create parameter controls.
Draws a control on an image. This is the main method the host application calls to draw a plug-in parameter control.
Defines the coordinate space for an event.
Figures out which part of the onscreen control was hit.
Provides information when a key is pressed.
Provides information when a key is released.
Provides information when the left mouse button is pressed and the pointer is on an image with an active plug-in control.
Provides information when the left mouse button is pressed and the pointer is moved with the mouse button still down.
Provides information when the mouse pointer enters the view.
Provides information when the mouse pointer leaves the view.
Provides information when the mouse pointer changes location.
Provides information when the left mouse button is released.

into which you should draw your OSCs.
The time at which to draw the control.
